label: def-mean-field-phase-space
nl_definition: The single-particle phase space Ω is the Cartesian product of a bounded convex position domain with a C² boundary and a closed ball of allowed velocities, representing all possible kinematic states of a particle under the constraints of the Euclidean Gas algorithm.

formal_conditions.text: X_valid is a bounded, convex subset of R^d with a C^2 boundary.
V_alg is the closed ball of allowed velocities with radius V_alg.
The phase space Ω is the Cartesian product.

properties.name: complete kinematic states
properties.description: encompasses all possible positions and velocities for a particle

properties.name: algorithmic constraints
properties.description: directly translates the position and velocity limits from the discrete Euclidean Gas algorithm

parameters.name: dimension
parameters.description: the dimension of the ambient Euclidean space

parameters.name: velocity bound
parameters.description: the maximum magnitude of allowed velocities in the algorithm

notes.text: The single-particle phase space defines the complete set of possible kinematic states—position and velocity—that a particle can occupy.
Properties are a direct, faithful translation of the constraints imposed on the walkers in the discrete Euclidean Gas algorithm, as defined in the Euclidean Gas specification (Chapter 2, Sec. 1.1).

label: def-phase-space-density
nl_definition: A non-negative function f on [0, ∞) × Ω representing the continuous probability density of alive particles in phase space, where its integral over subsets gives the expected fraction of alive walkers in those regions, and the total integral m_a(t) ≤ 1 measures the proportion of surviving particles.

formal_conditions.text: f maps to non-negative reals
For measurable A ⊆ Ω, alive mass in A is ∫_A f(t, z) dz
formal_conditions.latex: \int_A f(t, z) \, dz = \text{alive mass in } A

formal_conditions.text: Total alive mass m_a(t) ≤ 1
Dead mass m_d(t) = 1 - m_a(t)
Total mass conserved: m_a(t) + m_d(t) = 1

properties.name: non-negativity
properties.description: f(t, x, v) ≥ 0 for all t, x, v

properties.name: sub-probability
properties.description: Integrates to at most 1, reflecting possible particle death

properties.name: mass interpretation
properties.description: Integrals over phase space regions yield expected fractions of alive walkers

properties.name: conservation
properties.description: Total mass (alive + dead) remains 1

parameters.name: phase-space sub-probability density
parameters.description: Function describing the density of alive walkers in phase space at time t
constraints: ∫_A f(t, z) dz = alive mass in measurable A ⊆ Ω

parameters.name: alive mass
parameters.description: Total mass of alive walkers at time t
constraints: m_a(t) = ∫_Ω f(t, x, v) dx dv

parameters.name: dead mass
parameters.description: Total mass of dead walkers at time t

examples.text: Integrating f over a neighborhood in phase space gives the expected fraction of alive walkers there, analogous to population density integration yielding the number of people in a city neighborhood.

notes.text: The system's evolution is governed by a coupled PDE for f(t, z) and ODE for m_d(t), conserving total mass.

label: def-mean-field-moments
nl_definition: Functionals of the phase-space density f that compute the mean and variance of rewards (via single-particle expectations) and distances (via pairwise expectations) with respect to the normalized alive density f / m_a, ensuring consistency with N-particle empirical statistics in the mean-field limit.

properties.name: Normalization
properties.description: All moments use the normalized density f(t,z) / m_a(t) to match averages over alive particles.

properties.name: Functional dependence
properties.description: Moments depend on the full shape of f, denoted as μ[f] to emphasize this.

properties.name: Reward moments
properties.description: First and second moments of the reward R under the alive distribution.

properties.name: Distance moments
properties.description: First and second moments of pairwise distances d_Y(φ(z), φ(z')) under independent draws from the alive distribution.

parameters.name: phase-space density
parameters.description: The density function f(t, z) at time t over phase space Ω

parameters.name: total alive mass
parameters.description: The total mass of alive particles, m_a(t) = ∫_Ω f(t, z) dz

parameters.name: reward function
parameters.description: The reward associated with phase-space point z

parameters.name: observation map
parameters.description: The map φ: Ω → Y from phase space to observation space

parameters.name: observation distance
parameters.description: The distance metric d_Y on the observation space Y

parameters.name: phase space domain
parameters.description: The domain of the phase space

notes.text: These moments replace empirical sums over alive walkers in the N-particle system with integrals in the mean-field limit.
Normalization by m_a(t) ensures the mean-field model faithfully limits the particle averages over k alive walkers.

label: def-mean-field-patched-std
nl_definition: Functionals of the density f obtained by applying the regularized standard deviation function to the mean-field variance functionals, defined as \widehat{\sigma}_R[f](t) := \sigma'_{\text{reg}}(\sigma_R^2[f](t)) and \widehat{\sigma}_D[f](t) := \sigma'_{\text{reg}}(\sigma_D^2[f](t)).

formal_conditions.text: \hat{σ}_R[f](t) := σ'_{	ext{reg}}(σ_R^2[f](t))
\hat{σ}_D[f](t) := σ'_{	ext{reg}}(σ_D^2[f](t))

properties.name: numerical stability
properties.description: Prevents denominators in standardization from approaching zero when variance is close to zero

properties.name: continuity preservation
properties.description: Translates regularization mechanism from N-particle to mean-field level to maintain guarantees

parameters.name: density
parameters.description: probability density function on which the functionals are defined

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: time parameter for evaluation

parameters.name: regularized standard deviation function
parameters.description: the regularization function applied to variances

parameters.name: mean-field variance functional R
parameters.description: variance functional for the R component

parameters.name: mean-field variance functional D
parameters.description: variance functional for the D component

notes.text: To ensure the numerical stability and continuity guarantees of the N-particle algorithm are preserved, especially when the swarm is highly converged (true variance σ^2[f] close to zero), by translating the regularized standard deviation mechanism from Chapter 1 to the mean-field level.

label: def-mean-field-z-scores
nl_definition: For a particle at state z and a potential companion at state z_c, the mean-field Z-scores at time t standardize the raw measurement R(z) and the distance d_Y(φ(z), φ(z_c)) using global, density-dependent mean μ and standard deviation σ functionals.

parameters.name: density
parameters.description: Density function for density-dependent moments.

parameters.name: particle state
parameters.description: State of the particle.

parameters.name: companion state
parameters.description: State of the potential companion particle.

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Time parameter.

notes.text: Defined using density-dependent functionals derived in Section 1.2.

label: def-mean-field-fitness-potential
nl_definition: The Mean-Field Fitness Potential V[f](z, z_c, t) is a functional of the density f that multiplicatively combines rescaled mean-field Z-scores for diversity and reward to assess particle fitness relative to a companion, balancing exploitation and exploration.

formal_conditions.text: V[f](z, z_c, t) is defined as the product of powered terms involving rescaled Z-scores plus shift η

properties.name: Multiplicative Structure
properties.description: Combines reward and diversity contributions multiplicatively to balance exploitation and exploration

properties.name: Global Dependence
properties.description: Value at (z, z_c) depends on the entire shape of density f

properties.name: Rescaling
properties.description: Applies canonical Rescale Transformation g_A to Z-scores for normalization

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: Exponent for the reward channel contribution

parameters.name: beta
parameters.description: Exponent for the diversity channel contribution

parameters.name: eta
parameters.description: Shift parameter added before exponentiation to ensure positivity

parameters.name: density
parameters.description: Probability density function over states

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State of the particle

parameters.name: companion-state
parameters.description: State of the companion particle

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: Time parameter

notes.text: The final fitness potential combines the contributions from the reward and diversity channels multiplicatively. This structure allows the algorithm to balance the drive for high rewards (exploitation) with the need to maintain diversity (exploration). The potential is a functional of the density f, denoted V[f], to emphasize that its value at a single point (z, z_c) depends on the global shape of the entire probability distribution.

label: def-baoab-update-rule
nl_definition: A symmetric five-step splitting scheme for updating the position and velocity of a particle in underdamped Langevin dynamics over a time step τ, combining deterministic force kicks, position drifts, and an exact Ornstein-Uhlenbeck solve for friction and noise.

formal_conditions.text: B-Step (Force Kick): Velocity updated with half-step kick from conservative force.
A-Step (Position Drift): Position updated with half-step drift using new velocity.
O-Step (Ornstein-Uhlenbeck): Velocity updated for full timestep solving OU process with flow field u at midpoint, friction, and Gaussian noise.
A-Step (Position Drift): Position updated with final half-step drift.
B-Step (Force Kick): Velocity updated with final half-step kick using force at new position.

properties.name: symmetric-composition
properties.description: Splits SDE into analytically solvable parts (B, A, O) and composes them symmetrically for improved accuracy and stability.

properties.name: exact-O-step
properties.description: Exactly solves the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process for friction and thermal noise over the full timestep.

parameters.name: timestep
parameters.description: Time step size for the update.

parameters.name: mass
parameters.description: Particle mass.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: Conservative force function F(x).

parameters.name: friction-coefficient
parameters.description: Friction coefficient in the Ornstein-Uhlenbeck process.

parameters.name: thermal-energy
parameters.description: Thermal energy parameter related to temperature.

parameters.name: noise
parameters.description: Standard Gaussian random vector ξ ~ N(0, I_d).

notes.text: Applies to the underdamped Langevin SDE driven by a standard Wiener process, with parameters from the Euclidean Gas specification.
u(x) is the flow field, typically the equilibrium velocity or mean field in the gas model.

label: def-kinetic-generator
nl_definition: The kinetic transport operator is the Fokker-Planck operator that governs the continuous-time evolution of alive walkers in phase space via independent underdamped Langevin stochastic differential equations, incorporating drift, friction, and diffusion terms, subject to reflecting boundary conditions on position and velocity domains.

formal_conditions.text: W_t is a standard d-dimensional Wiener process.
Reflecting boundary conditions at \partial X_{\text{valid}} for positions.
Reflecting or squash boundary conditions at \|v\| = V_{\text{alg}} for velocities, modeling the velocity cap \psi_v.

formal_conditions.latex: \mathcal{L}_{\text{kin}} f = \sum_{i \in \mathcal{A}} \left[ v_i \cdot \nabla_{x_i} f + \left( m^{-1} F(x_i) - \gamma_{\mathrm{fric}} (v_i - u(x_i)) \right) \cdot \nabla_{v_i} f + \frac{\sigma_v^2}{2} \, \Delta_{v_i} f \right]

properties.name: Domain
properties.description: Acts on test functions f defined on the swarm state space for alive walkers \mathcal{A} in phase space \Omega.

properties.name: Structure
properties.description: Sum of independent single-particle generators over alive walkers.

properties.name: Boundary Handling
properties.description: Ensures no mass loss through reflecting conditions on position domain X_{\text{valid}} and velocity ball V_{\text{alg}}.

properties.name: Approximation
properties.description: Continuous limit of the discrete-time BAOAB integrator in the Euclidean Gas algorithm.

parameters.name: mass
parameters.description: Mass parameter of the walkers

parameters.name: friction coefficient
parameters.description: Friction coefficient in the velocity update

parameters.name: velocity diffusion
parameters.description: Standard deviation of the velocity noise

parameters.name: force function
parameters.description: Force acting on position x_i

parameters.name: drift field
parameters.description: Drift velocity field u(x_i)

parameters.name: alive walkers set
parameters.description: Set of indices for alive particles

parameters.name: velocity ball radius
parameters.description: Radius of the velocity constraint domain

parameters.name: velocity cap
parameters.description: Function enforcing velocity cap

notes.text: This operator models the diffusive kinetic portion of the dynamics between cloning events and death/revival transitions.
The SDE is subject to parameters from the Euclidean Gas model, ensuring confinement within valid domains.
Position reflection prevents trajectories from leaving \partial X_{\text{valid}}, while velocity reflection mimics the cap \psi_v.

label: def-killing-operator
nl_definition: The interior killing operator models death by removing mass from the alive density f at a position- and velocity-dependent rate c(z) f(z), where c is a smooth non-negative function that vanishes in safe interior regions and is positive near invalid boundaries, ensuring PDE regularity.

formal_conditions.text: c: Ω → [0, ∞), smooth and non-negative.
Safety in the interior: c(z) = 0 for all z in a safe subset of Ω away from the position boundary.
formal_conditions.latex: c(z) = 0 \, \forall z \in \text{safe subset of } \Omega \text{ away from position boundary}

formal_conditions.text: Activity near the boundary: c(z) > 0 in a smooth transition layer near ∂X_valid × V_alg.
formal_conditions.latex: c(z) > 0 \text{ in smooth transition layer near } \partial X_{\text{valid}} \times V_{\text{alg}}

formal_conditions.text: Smoothness: c ∈ C^∞(Ω) to ensure regularity of the PDE solutions.
formal_conditions.latex: c \in C^\infty(\Omega) \text{ to ensure PDE regularity}

properties.name: Killing Mechanism
properties.description: Removes mass from the alive density f at the rate c(z) f(z).

properties.name: Total Mass Killed Functional
properties.description: k_killed[f](t) := ∫_Ω c(z) f(t,z) dz, representing the total mass killed per unit time.

properties.name: Boundary Behavior
properties.description: c is zero in safe interiors and positive near invalid boundaries to model risk.

parameters.name: interior killing rate
parameters.description: A smooth, non-negative function mapping the domain to non-negative reals, modeling the killing rate.
constraints: c(z) = 0 for all z in a safe subset of Ω away from the position boundary
c(z) > 0 in a smooth transition layer near ∂X_valid × V_alg

parameters.name: alive density
parameters.description: The density function of alive agents at time t and state z.

notes.text: The smoothness of c ensures the regularity of solutions to the associated partial differential equations (PDEs) modeling the system.
This operator is used to enforce safety by penalizing states near invalid boundaries without abrupt killing.

label: def-revival-operator
nl_definition: A source term that re-injects mass from the dead population back into the alive population at positions proportional to the current alive density, modeling revival by cloning from alive companions.

formal_conditions.text: B[f, m_d](t, z) := λ_revive · m_d(t) · (f(t,z) / m_a(t))
m_d(t) = 1 - m_a(t)
f(t,z)/m_a(t) is the normalized alive density

properties.name: Total mass revived per unit time
properties.description: The integral of B[f, m_d](t,z) over Ω equals λ_revive · m_d(t), ensuring the revived mass is proportional to the dead mass.

parameters.name: revival rate
parameters.description: Constant rate at which mass is revived from the dead population, independent of timestep.

parameters.name: dead mass
parameters.description: Current mass in the dead population at time t.

parameters.name: alive mass
parameters.description: Current mass in the alive population at time t.

parameters.name: alive density
parameters.description: Density function of the alive population at time t and position z.

notes.text: λ_revive typically ranges from 0.1 to 5.
This form mirrors the discrete algorithm where dead walkers select companions uniformly from the alive set and clone to their positions.

label: def-cloning-generator
nl_definition: The mean-field limit of the discrete cloning mechanism, defined as a mass-neutral, non-local operator that decomposes into sink and source terms acting on the particle density function.

formal_conditions.text: S[f](t, z) = S_src[f](t, z) - S_sink[f](t, z)
formal_conditions.latex: S[f](t, z) = S_{\text{src}}[f](t, z) - S_{\text{sink}}[f](t, z)

formal_conditions.text: Sink term: S_sink[f](t,z) = (1/τ) f(t,z) ∫_Ω P_clone[f/m_a](z, z_c) (f(t,z_c)/m_a(t)) dz_c
Source term: S_src[f](t,z) = (1/(τ m_a(t))) ∫_Ω ∫_Ω f(t,z_d) f(t,z_c) P_clone[f/m_a](z_d, z_c) Q_δ(z | z_c) dz_d dz_c
formal_conditions.latex: S_{\text{src}}[f](t,z) = \frac{1}{\tau m_a(t)} \int_{\Omega} \int_{\Omega} f(t,z_d) f(t,z_c) P_{\text{clone}}[f/m_a](z_d, z_c) Q_{\delta}(z \mid z_c) \,\mathrm{d}z_d\,\mathrm{d}z_c

properties.name: Mass-neutrality
properties.description: The integral of S[f] over Ω is zero by construction, preserving total mass: ∫_Ω S[f](t,z) dz = 0

properties.name: Non-locality
properties.description: Depends on integrals over the entire domain Ω, coupling densities at different states z

properties.name: Rate conversion
properties.description: The factor 1/τ converts discrete per-step probabilities to continuous-time rates

parameters.name: density function
parameters.description: particle density function f(t, z)

parameters.name: state variable
parameters.description: position in state space Ω

parameters.name: time
parameters.description: time parameter

parameters.name: timestep
parameters.description: discrete timestep for rate conversion

parameters.name: alive mass
parameters.description: total mass of alive particles m_a(t)

parameters.name: cloning probability
parameters.description: probability P_clone[f/m_a](z_d, z_c) based on fitness

parameters.name: jitter kernel
parameters.description: jitter kernel Q_δ(z | z_c) with integral 1

notes.text: P_clone[f/m_a](z_d, z_c) depends on fitness values from the normalized alive density f/m_a
Q_δ(z | z_c) is Gaussian in position and delta in velocity
Mass neutrality verified by integrating source and sink terms, using ∫ Q_δ dz = 1, showing both integrals equal and cancel

label: def-transport-operator
nl_definition: The transport operator L^\\dagger is the formal L^2-adjoint of the backward kinetic generator L, acting on a probability density f, and expressed in conservative form as the negative divergence of a probability flux vector J with positional and velocity components involving advection, drift, and diffusion.

formal_conditions.text:
L^\dagger f = -
abla \cdot J[f] = -
abla_x \cdot J_x[f] - 
abla_v \cdot J_v[f]
J_x[f] = v f - D_x \nabla_x f
J_v[f] = A_v f - D_v \nabla_v f

properties.name: conservative form
properties.description: Expressed as the negative divergence of a probability flux vector J.

properties.name: positional flux J_x
properties.description: Combines advection (v f) and Fickian diffusion (-D_x \nabla_x f).

properties.name: velocity flux J_v
properties.description: Combines drift (A_v f) and Fickian diffusion (-D_v \nabla_v f).

parameters.name: backward kinetic generator
parameters.description: The backward kinetic generator from Section 2.2.

parameters.name: transport operator
parameters.description: Formal L^2-adjoint of L acting on density f.

parameters.name: density
parameters.description: Probability density on which the operator acts.

parameters.name: probability flux vector
parameters.description: Vector with components (J_x, J_v).

parameters.name: positional flux
parameters.description: v f - D_x \nabla_x f (advection + Fickian diffusion).

parameters.name: velocity flux
parameters.description: A_v f - D_v \nabla_v f (drift + Fickian diffusion).

parameters.name: velocity
parameters.description: Velocity field in positional flux.

parameters.name: positional diffusion coefficient
parameters.description: Diffusion coefficient for position.

parameters.name: positional gradient
parameters.description: Gradient with respect to position.

parameters.name: velocity drift
parameters.description: Drift term in velocity flux.

parameters.name: velocity diffusion coefficient
parameters.description: Diffusion coefficient for velocity.

parameters.name: velocity gradient
parameters.description: Gradient with respect to velocity.

notes.text: The kinetic part of the evolution, described by the generator \mathcal{L}_{kin}, corresponds to a local transport of probability density via drift and diffusion. Its representation in the forward equation is given by the formal adjoint of \mathcal{L}_{kin}, which is the Fokker-Planck operator.
